sub_faqs.question: What is Digital Evaluation?
sub_faqs.answer:
Digital Evaluation is the process of assessing student answer scripts on-screen instead of manually checking physical copies.

Benefits:
- Accuracy
- Transparency
- Faster results

sub_faqs.question: Can I evaluate from home?
sub_faqs.answer:
Center Evaluation: Most institutions require designated centers.
Remote Evaluation: Allowed only if officially approved by the Board/University.

sub_faqs.question: Supported Browsers
sub_faqs.answer:
- Google Chrome (Recommended)
- Mozilla Firefox

sub_faqs.question: Minimum Internet Speed
sub_faqs.answer: Stable 20–50 Mbps recommended.

sub_faqs.question: Can I use a mobile hotspot?
sub_faqs.answer:
Not recommended.
Prefer LAN or strong Wi‑Fi.

sub_faqs.question: Supported Operating Systems
sub_faqs.answer:
- Windows 10/11
- macOS (latest)
- Linux (limited support)

sub_faqs.question: Recommended Screen Resolution
sub_faqs.answer: Minimum 1366 × 768 pixels.

sub_faqs.question: Can I see total marks?
sub_faqs.answer: Displayed automatically after marking all questions.

sub_faqs.question: What does “Session Expire” mean?
sub_faqs.answer:
Session ended due to inactivity.
Log in again to continue.

sub_faqs.question: Access after office hours?
sub_faqs.answer:
Yes, DigiMarker is available 24/7.
Ensure stable internet.

sub_faqs.question: How do I log in to DigiMarker?
sub_faqs.answer:
1) Use the username & password sent to your registered email.
2) Visit the official URL / local server link.
3) Enter credentials → Click Login.

sub_faqs.question: How do I access my assigned scripts for evaluation?
sub_faqs.answer:
1) After login → Click Start to open Dashboard.
2) Select the Subject Code with available scripts.
3) Click Change → Message: “DEFAULT SUBJECT UPDATED SUCCESSFULLY”.
4) Click Start Marking → Begin evaluation.

sub_faqs.question: Not Receiving Email or OTP?
sub_faqs.answer:
Try these steps:
- Check your Inbox (OTP emails may go to Spam/Junk)
- Ensure you are using the registered email ID / mobile number
- Wait 2–5 minutes (server delay/queue)
- Ensure internet is stable and inbox isn’t full
- If still not received, contact Help Desk/Admin

sub_faqs.question: Troubleshooting Login Errors
sub_faqs.answer:
If login fails:
- Check username/password carefully
- Use stable Wi‑Fi or LAN (avoid hotspots)
- Clear browser cache & cookies, then retry
- System date/time must be correct
- If account is locked, contact Help Desk/Admin
- Ensure firewall/antivirus is not blocked.

sub_faqs.question: System error: Date & Time
sub_faqs.answer:
Cause: Incorrect system clock.
Solution:
1) Right-click clock → Change Date/Time
2) Sync with Internet Time
3) Save & retry login

sub_faqs.question: How to ensure correct Date & Time?
sub_faqs.answer:
Sync with Internet Time.
Wrong time may block DigiMarker access.

sub_faqs.question: Forgot Password?
sub_faqs.answer: Use the Forgot Password option, or contact Help Desk.

sub_faqs.question: What if the marking panel is not showing after right-click?
sub_faqs.answer:
For the marking panel to appear:
1) First select/click the particular question number in the script panel.
2) Then right-click on that question area.
3) The marking panel will pop up (options to enter marks, comments, etc.).

If you right-click on blank space/outside the question area, the marking panel will not show.

sub_faqs.question: How do I mark answers?
sub_faqs.answer:
1) Select Question Number.
2) Right-click → Enter marks.
3) Marks auto-save & totals are auto-calculated.

sub_faqs.question: Can I change marks?
sub_faqs.answer:
Yes:
- Select the question → Use Undo to remove.
- Re-enter marks → Auto-saved & re-totaled.

sub_faqs.question: What if a page is blank?
sub_faqs.answer:
Use the Cross-Annotation Tool.
The system records it as 0 automatically.

sub_faqs.question: How is totaling handled?
sub_faqs.answer:
DigiMarker auto-calculates totals.

Ensure every question is marked before submission.

sub_faqs.question: What if I skip a question?
sub_faqs.answer:
Warning: “You have not marked all questions and pages.”

Review the script carefully before submission.

sub_faqs.question: What if the student leaves questions unattempted?
sub_faqs.answer:
Always record “0” marks with remark “NA” instead of leaving it blank, so the system registers it as evaluated.
Otherwise, the system will flag it during submission with a message like:
“You have not marked these questions.”

sub_faqs.question: Annotations Toolbar
sub_faqs.answer:
Tools available at the top of the screen:
- Right Tick – Correct answers
- Wrong Sign – Incorrect answers
- Question Mark – Doubtful answers
- Comment Box – Add notes
- Rectangle / Circle – Highlight areas
- Undo / Redo actions

sub_faqs.question: Facility to Rotate Answer Sheet
sub_faqs.answer:
Rotate scanned answer sheets for best viewing angle.
Ensures clear visibility, making evaluation smoother & faster.

sub_faqs.question: How to view QUESTION PAPER or MODEL ANSWER
sub_faqs.answer:
When you open the Answer Script, you will see two tabs beside it:
- QUESTION PAPER → Opens the exam paper.
- MODEL ANSWER → Opens the official answer key.

How to view:
1) Open your answer script in the portal.
2) On the top/right side, click QUESTION PAPER or MODEL ANSWER.
3) The file will open.

sub_faqs.question: How do I reject an answer sheet?
sub_faqs.answer:
1) Click Reject (top-right corner toolbar).
2) Select reason:
- Wrong Language
- Wrong Set
- Wrong Subject
- Blurred Pages
- Incomplete Script

sub_faqs.question: Reject Option (Detailed)
sub_faqs.answer:
Use Reject (top-right corner) when a script cannot be evaluated.
Select valid reason (e.g., Wrong Subject, Blurred Scan, Incomplete Script).
The script is removed from dashboard & reassigned by Admin.

sub_faqs.question: How do I confirm submission?
sub_faqs.answer:
Click Submit Evaluation.
Confirmation: “Sheet Successfully Saved.”
Script disappears from dashboard.

sub_faqs.question: Unable to save answer sheet?
sub_faqs.answer:
Cause: Poor internet speed.
Solution:
- Avoid mobile hotspots
- Use Wi‑Fi or LAN
- Restart router if needed

sub_faqs.question: Logged out or unable to save?
sub_faqs.answer:
Often due to unstable internet.
- Avoid mobile hotspots
- Use Wi‑Fi or LAN
- Restart router if needed

sub_faqs.question: Error: “No more sheet showing” – Case 1
sub_faqs.answer:
All assigned scripts have been evaluated.
Confirm with Help Desk if quota is complete.

sub_faqs.question: Error: “No more sheet showing” – Case 2
sub_faqs.answer:
Causes:
1) Answer scripts assigned to multiple markers → Contact Help Desk to unassign from inactive markers
2) Question paper marking not completed → Ask Admin to complete setup → Refresh & continue

sub_faqs.question: System hangs or crashes?
sub_faqs.answer:
Auto-save is active.
Re-login and continue.
If issue persists → Contact Help Desk.

sub_faqs.question: System crash during marking?
sub_faqs.answer:
Save work → Restart → Re-login.
If scripts are missing → Contact support.

sub_faqs.question: Error: “Network Not Available”
sub_faqs.answer: Check internet, switch network, and retry login.

sub_faqs.question: The application is not loading or working slow. What should I do?
sub_faqs.answer:
Try the following steps:
- Refresh the page
- Clear your browser cache and cookies
- Try opening the application in a different browser
If the issue persists, please contact the Help Desk for support.

sub_faqs.question: I am getting an error message. What should I do?
sub_faqs.answer:
If you encounter an error message:
- Take a clear screenshot of the error
- Raise a Help Desk ticket with:
  - Date and time of the issue
  - Action being performed when the error occurred
  - Screenshot of the error message

This will help the support team resolve your issue faster.

sub_faqs.question: Role of Head Marker in Digital Evaluation
sub_faqs.answer:
Acts as second-level evaluator after examiners.
Re-checks answer sheets for fairness, consistency & quality control.

sub_faqs.question: Head Marker & Deputy Head Marker Assignment Criteria
sub_faqs.answer:
Assigned based on university/institution guidelines.
Selection depends on subject expertise, experience & academic requirements.

sub_faqs.question: Role of Deputy Head Marker in Digital Evaluation
sub_faqs.answer:
Acts as first-level evaluator after examiners.
Re-checks answer sheets for fairness, consistency & quality control.
Blue colour mark/notation indicates the booklet has been rechecked by the Deputy.

sub_faqs.question: Role of Head Marker in Digital Evaluation (after Deputy Head Marker)
sub_faqs.answer:
Acts as second-level evaluator after Deputy Head Marker.
Re-checks answer sheets for fairness, consistency & quality control.
Red colour mark/notation indicates the booklet has been rechecked by the Head Marker.

sub_faqs.question: Do’s & Don’ts for Evaluators
sub_faqs.answer:
Do’s:
- Follow official marking guidelines
- Maintain confidentiality
- Use system features correctly (annotations, reject, submit)
- Report issues promptly
- Ensure date, time & internet are correct

Don’ts:
- Do not share login credentials
- Do not alter marks/data outside DigiMarker
- Avoid unauthorized devices/networks
- Do not discuss/share student scripts/marks outside official channels
- Do not leave the system unattended while logged in

sub_faqs.question: Precautions while evaluating
sub_faqs.answer:
- Do not share login credentials
- Don’t leave system unattended
- Save work frequently
- Follow official evaluation guidelines

sub_faqs.question: Whom to contact for technical issues?
sub_faqs.answer: Help Desk at Command Center – First point of contact for all login, access, or technical issues.

sub_faqs.question: What are the Help Desk working hours?
sub_faqs.answer:
The Help Desk is available Monday to Friday, from 9:30 AM to 6:30 PM.
Closed on weekends and government holidays.

sub_faqs.question: How to Download Date-wise Checked Booklets Count from evaluator login
sub_faqs.answer:
1) Login to the Dashboard.
2) Go to Date-wise Checked Booklets.
3) Click Export.
File will download with date-wise checked booklets count.
